qmsStandards.qmsModification: 1. Discover The entry point to Netsmart’s software development process is referred to as the “Discover” phase. At an organizational level, opportunities that require new development are identified, decided on, and prioritized. There are multiple avenues for ideas and issues to be identified. Such avenues entail: Client Portal, Support Requests for Enhancements or Faults, Internal and External Collaboration, Regulatory or Custom Controls at the Facility, Local, State, Federal, or Affiliated Agency Levels. Internal and external opportunities are reviewed when presented and analyzed to determine market need, revenue potential, technical debt, and scalability across the platforms. Annually, the opportunities resulting from final selection will comprise the upcoming annual solution roadmap. If required, a business case is prepared and presented to the identified stakeholders in order to gain approval, needed funding, and clear entrance and exit criteria. This allows Netsmart the ability to align the strategic direction with the expected results and initiatives as defined in the roadmap. Once approved, a Project Lead is identified to collaborate with necessary parties to identify, gather, and present the following:  Vision and Success Criteria  Initial Business Requirements or User Stories  Project Team Assignment and Procurement  Known Infrastructure, environment, or facility needs.  Engineering Milestones, Tools, and Release Schedule  Risk Assessment  Control, Monitoring, Traceability Metrics and tools  Documentation and Tracking Repository, tools, and change management  Communication strategy (who, what, when, how)  Client Partnership & Engagement Plans Alignment to the Quality Management System will entail a kick-off meeting or discussion and assignment where all members are aware of their level of involvement and commitment, roles within the sprints/iterations, schedule & release plan, and overall vision and purpose for the project. This phase closely models ISO 9901:2015(E) Section 4 (Context of the Organization), Section 6 (Planning), Section 7 (Support). Further scheduled monitoring and control sessions include presenting the state of progression in accordance with the defined roadmap.

2. Design This includes all aspects of software design which are performed iteratively following the Discover phase. At the forefront of each iteration, requirements are reviewed by the Product and Engineering team. Requirements can come in many forms and completeness. At the minimum the business will have identified the User Stories or High Level Business Requirements that are required for the work product during the initiation phase, and stored centrally. These will comprise the baseline set to start the conversation. Once this is achieved one of two things can occur: 1. A Business Analyst can further expand the requirements into a more detailed specification, along with identified functional requirements. This work is to be done one iteration out to ensure the team members can perform their assigned tasks. OR 2. The Test Cases can become the requirements being identified at the start of and throughout the iteration as collaboration occurs and the product evolves. If requirements are initially captured keeping testing in mind, they begin to build themselves and quickly evolve into tests themselves with minimal alteration. A review of the available baseline requirements occurs normally at the first part of an iteration to gather any additional information required to proceed for the committed stories in the iteration. In the event the user story is not complete or additional stories are required, the team generates them at the beginning of the iteration. This may include engaging stakeholders and clients as necessary. If the story or stories are identified as needing to shift back into the backlog, they can be removed from the iteration and assigned to the backlog during the first part of the iteration. If the project involves a user interface, user experience wireframes and/or presentation layers with graphics are also developed in the initial stages as part of the requirements, and iteratively expanded as needed. These create a visual and in some cases interactive preview of the solution prior to development. Requirements and design artifacts are continually evaluated to be in alignment with the solution and in accordance with expectations as outlined in ISO 9901:2015(E) Section 8.2 (Requirements for products and services) and 8.3 (Design of products and services) to ensure adherence to the overall organization and product strategy and alignment with client and stakeholder needs. The design effort for each project will vary based on the nature and complexity of the development activity required. The inputs required for development to commence will be generated.

3. Develop The “Develop” phase refers to the iterative development and release of the solution, and as such involves further expansion of the items noted in the “Design” phase as well as code construction. This primarily models ISO 9901:2015(E) Section 8.3 (Development of products and services), Section 8.4 (Control of externally provided processes, products and services), and Section 8.7 (Control of nonconforming outputs). Each User Story and/or Scenario should be finite encapsulating a small work deliverable, each with their Level of Effort captured. This allows for the ability to transform into a set of unit tests that can be further validated upon each build and/or execution. Each test is not to become a constraint on change but rather enable it. The tests are not to be too tightly coupled with the implementation of the code that is being tested. Such tests are about the interactions between the objects as much as within the object itself. The development team proceeds with code construction with possible testing occurring in parallel to development efforts. Generally the timeframe for the first development “sprint” will not exceed 3 weeks, with 2 weeks being the average. The result of the initial sprint is referred to as “Iteration 0” and becomes the starting place for all future iterative development sprints. The primary goal is to complete enough of a set of software work items to constitute a demonstrable and encapsulated version that can be built and further released. Continuous collaboration with all team members is facilitated so that we can successfully deliver on commitments and have the agility and ability to adapt quickly to change and re-factor where needed. The same standards apply for design rules/patterns, code check-in/check-out procedures, code review, coding & build standards, and traceability to requirements. As development is occurring, critical faults found prior to release should be resolved within that iteration. Lower severity faults can be placed into backlog for inclusion into other iterations. In addition to development, other activities to be considered are:  Iteration Demo: If at the end of an iteration, a release is not planned, it can be beneficial to create a short demo of the work that has been completed. It can be distributed internally to keep all interested parties aware of the progress and promote further feedback from varying parties.  Technical Code Review: All the source code that is generated during the iteration is to be qualified for completeness, standards compliance, and ability for the design and solution to meet the business needs in the short and long term. If this does not occur at the closure of an iteration it must occur prior to the release.

4. Deliver Delivery includes the continual distribution, communication, and implementations of the solution. Upon deployment, ongoing support, control analysis, defect management, continued product improvements, and release documentation will occur in alignment with ISO 9901:2015(E) Section 8.5 (Production and service provision), section 9 (Performance evaluation), and section 10 (Improvement). This may involve the inclusion of a maintenance team, additional parties, and hosting and security team. As such, a plan and transition will occur to ensure proper handover upon production release. For project releases, the warranty phase will continue to fall under scope of the Project Lead to manage and publish status. First of a Kind (FOAK) development effort will undergo Early Adopter testing with a previously identified and contracted client. This will constitute “real world” testing with the Netsmart and client teams often working side by side to identify any issues or recommended improvements. These items are evaluated and incorporated as appropriate prior to a general release to all clients. The periodic review of solution roadmaps, support management, and infrastructure processes will apply to the future maintenance of the work product and each release that occurs thereafter. As updates are applied, the need to maintain supporting documentation and transition practices remain. The cycle through the process is similar to that of a larger project, just smaller in scale. Key components to ongoing quality management for solutions include: Regression Root Cause Analysis process, continued regression test automation, infrastructure monitoring, support trending and monitoring, client health score cards, highlighted client focus, and periodic review of the QMS and facets within.  The Root Cause Analysis process enforces the proper review, expanded automation, and a continued improvement upstream so as to not reintroduce non-conformity into the solution. As well, other possible faults that could have been introduced are prevented once preventive action is in place as defining is to be broader in scope.  Specific client focus includes keying in on edge case clients to sharpen the focus on specific faults and identified patterns. Regression Root Cause Analysis may occur as well as further analysis, solution review and improvement.  Support and Social board discussion highlights and pattern recognition are continuously reviewed. Recurring reviews are required with Engineering and Support to ensure proper review and analysis more proactively.  4D Project Roadmap ensures the right projects are selected and tracked in accordance with the overall organization strategic direction and vision.

Description of Netsmart’s Quality Management System Netsmart’s approach to quality begins with our software development methodology. Netsmart has adopted an agile methodology for software development which focuses on the 4 primary components to software solutions and their evolution: Discover, Design, Develop, and Deliver. Netsmart’s Quality Management System models facets of the ISO 9001:2015(E) Quality Management Principles and Requirements: • Customer focus • Leadership • Engagement of People • Process Approach • Improvement • Evidence-based decision making • Relationship Management Each component embodies the principles and requirements within itself and across the systems. The systematic definition, management, and adherence to defined processes enables Netsmart to effectively work towards realizing overall Client and Organization strategic objectives. Leadership is committed to upholding each phase of the QMS via several targeted control metrics and monitoring structured for each phase as modeled in ISO 9001:2015(E) Section 5 (Leadership) and Section 7 (Support). Achievement of such is seen through some of the measures at varying levels below: • Broad level: KPI Dashboards, Quarterly Operations Book and Quality Trending, Sync Sessions, Town hall, Regulatory requirements, Infrastructure Alerts & Monitoring • Project Level: 4D Review Sessions, Resource Alignment & Procurement, Artifact repository, Entrance & Exit criteria, Market acceptance, project profitability. • Client Level: Client Health Scorecards, Innovations voting • Personnel: Recruiting, aligned qualifications and competency, direct accountability, clear roles and responsibilities, annual review process, Training

Develop Continued… Testing At Netsmart, quality is the responsibility of the team as a whole. All active members become functional experts and can perform the test role in creating test cases based on the need during that iteration. This evolution continues to retain some concepts and types of testing. Newer types include exploratory testing where the story is not fully complete or even fully defined. It could be required to vet out an idea and feasibility. The most prominent is Business Acceptance Testing and Functional Testing though it now occurs while development is still occurring as well as when completed. Further risk mitigation occurs with regression test automation. At the start of each iteration, with the other team members, the test plan and required test cases are established. The test cases may become the definitive set of requirements as clarity is established and the abstract and nebulous statements are further elaborated upon. Effectively, these are created Just-In-Time and comprising the detailed specifications. The collaboration and the integration of cross-functional roles allows the testers to gain a greater technical understanding of the design and architecture enabling more meaningful discussions for the project and projects downstream. All methods of tests can be performed within an iteration. Some can be done independently for those that are specialized or performed by another party that is not a member of the team. Each test further validates the development outputs meet the requirements as identified. This includes all functional and non-functional validation for the solution and external 3rd party integration and contractual requirements and processes. The inconsistencies or gaps identified in the test results are continually reviewed with corresponding development cycles occurring for resolution. Final results for conformity are produced to properly evaluate release readiness and alignment to exit or success criteria. Release with non-conforming results will have been agreed upon by stakeholders and communicated to clients which may include inclusion of known issues in a release note. Release Each release is designed to deliver a “shippable” work product with all the necessary supporting marketing material, packaging, support transitions, client communication strategy, and documentation. Delivery can include publishing to a client system, hosting internally, or a packaged product. For work that is within the scope of a project, the tasks are to be managed by the identified Project Lead to ensure tracking and completion. An approaching release candidate affirms QMS adherence as modeled in ISO 9901:2015(E) Section 8 (Operation) and specifically section 8.6 (Release of products and services)

cqmResults.title: Aspirin Prescribed at Discharge
cqmResults.description: Acute myocardial infarction (AMI) patients prescribed aspirin at hospital discharge

cqmResults.title: Hospital Harm - Falls with Injury
cqmResults.description: This ratio measure assesses the number of inpatient hospitalizations where at least one fall with a major or moderate injury occurs among the total qualifying inpatient hospital days for patients age 18 years and older

cqmResults.title: Assessed for Rehabilitation
cqmResults.description: Ischemic or hemorrhagic stroke patients who were assessed for rehabilitation services

cqmResults.title: Severe Obstetric Complications
cqmResults.description: Patients with severe obstetric complications which occur during the inpatient delivery hospitalization.

cqmResults.title: Discharged on Antithrombotic Therapy
cqmResults.description: Ischemic stroke patients prescribed or continuing to take antithrombotic therapy at hospital discharge

cqmResults.title: Discharged on Statin Medication
cqmResults.description: Ischemic stroke patients who are prescribed or continuing to take statin medication at hospital discharge

cqmResults.title: Excessive Radiation Dose or Inadequate Image Quality for Diagnostic Computed Tomography (CT) in Adults (Clinician Level)
cqmResults.description: This measure provides a standardized method for monitoring the performance of diagnostic CT to discourage unnecessarily high radiation doses, a risk factor for cancer, while preserving image quality. It is expressed as a percentage of patients with CT exams that are out-of-range based on having either excessive radiation dose or inadequate image quality relative to evidence-based thresholds based on the clinical indication for the exam. All diagnostic CT exams of specified anatomic sites performed in inpatient, outpatient and ambulatory care settings are eligible. This measure is not telehealth eligible. This eCQM requires the use of additional software to access primary data elements stored within radiology electronic health records and translate them into data elements that can be ingested by this eCQM. Additional details are included in the Guidance field.

cqmResults.title: Stroke Education
cqmResults.description: Ischemic or hemorrhagic stroke patients or their caregivers who were given educational materials during the hospital stay addressing all of the following: activation of emergency medical system, need for follow-up after discharge, medications prescribed at discharge, risk factors for stroke, and warning signs and symptoms of stroke

cqmResults.title: Excessive Radiation Dose or Inadequate Image Quality for Diagnostic Computed Tomography (CT) in Adults (Facility IQR)
cqmResults.description: This measure provides a standardized method for monitoring the performance of diagnostic CT to discourage unnecessarily high radiation doses, a risk factor for cancer, while preserving image quality. This measure is expressed as a percentage of CT exams that are out-of-range based on having either excessive radiation dose or inadequate image quality relative to evidence-based thresholds based on the clinical indication for the exam. All diagnostic CT exams of specified anatomic sites performed in hospital inpatient care settings are eligible. This eCQM requires the use of additional software to access primary data elements stored within radiology electronic health records and translate them into data elements that can be ingested by this eCQM. Additional details are included in the Guidance field.

cqmResults.title: Venous Thromboembolism Prophylaxis
cqmResults.description: This measure assesses the number of patients who received VTE prophylaxis or have documentation why no VTE prophylaxis was given the day of or the day after hospital admission or surgery end date for surgeries that start the day of or the day after hospital admission

cqmResults.title: Venous Thromboembolism Patients Receiving Unfractionated Heparin with Dosages/Platelet Count Monitoring by Protocol or Nomogram
cqmResults.description: This measure assesses the number of patients diagnosed with confirmed VTE who received intravenous (IV) UFH therapy dosages AND had their platelet counts monitored using defined parameters such as a nomogram or protocol.

cqmResults.title: Venous Thromboembolism Discharge Instructions
cqmResults.description: This measure assesses the number of patients diagnosed with confirmed VTE that are discharged to home, home care, court/law enforcement or home on hospice care on warfarin with written discharge instructions that address all four criteria: compliance issues, dietary advice, follow-up monitoring, and information about the potential for adverse drug reactions/ interactions.

cqmResults.title: Median Admit Decision Time to ED Departure Time for Admitted Patients
cqmResults.description: Median time (in minutes) from admit decision time to time of departure from the emergency department for emergency department patients admitted to inpatient status.

cqmResults.title: Elective Delivery
cqmResults.description: Patients with elective vaginal deliveries or elective cesarean births at >= 37 and < 39 weeks of gestation completed

cqmResults.title: Incidence of Potentially-Preventable Venous Thromboembolism
cqmResults.description: This measure assesses the number of patients diagnosed with confirmed VTE during hospitalization (not present at admission) who did not receive VTE prophylaxis between hospital admission and the day before the VTE diagnostic testing order date.

cqmResults.title: HIV Annual Retention in Care
cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients, regardless of age, with a diagnosis of Human Immunodeficiency Virus (HIV) during the first 240 days of the measurement period or before the measurement period who had at least two eligible encounters or at least one eligible encounter and one HIV viral load test that were at least 90 days apart within the measurement period

cqmResults.title: Childhood Immunization Status
cqmResults.description: Percentage of children 2 years of age who had four diphtheria, tetanus and acellular pertussis (DTaP); three polio (IPV), one measles, mumps and rubella (MMR); three H influenza type B (HiB); three hepatitis B (Hep B); one chicken pox (VZV); four pneumococcal conjugate (PCV); one hepatitis A (Hep A); two or three rotavirus (RV); and two influenza (flu) vaccines by their second birthday.

Clinical Quality Measures - Import and Calculate

cqmResults.title: Sexually Transmitted Infection (STI) Testing for People with HIV
cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients 13 years of age and older with a diagnosis of HIV who had tests for syphilis, gonorrhea, and chlamydia performed within the measurement period

cqmResults.title: Excessive Radiation Dose or Inadequate Image Quality for Diagnostic Computed Tomography (CT) in Adults (Facility OQR)
cqmResults.description: This measure is an episode of care measure that provides a standardized method for monitoring the performance of diagnostic CT to discourage unnecessarily high radiation doses, a risk factor for cancer, while preserving image quality. This measure is expressed as a percentage of CT exams that are out-of-range based on having either excessive radiation dose or inadequate image quality relative to evidence-based thresholds based on the clinical indication for the exam. All diagnostic CT exams of specified anatomic sites performed in hospital non-inpatient care settings (including emergency settings) are eligible. This eCQM requires the use of additional software to access primary data elements stored within radiology electronic health records and translate them into data elements that can be ingested by this eCQM. Additional details are included in the Guidance field.

cqmResults.title: Hospital Harm - Postoperative Respiratory Failure
cqmResults.description: This measure assesses the number of elective inpatient hospitalizations for patients aged 18 years and older without an obstetrical condition who have a procedure resulting in postoperative respiratory failure (PRF)

cqmResults.title: Diabetes: Hemoglobin A1c (HbA1c) Poor Control (> 9%)
cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients 18-75 years of age with diabetes who had hemoglobin A1c > 9.0% during the measurement period

cqmResults.title: Diabetes: Foot Exam
cqmResults.description: The percentage of patients 18-75 years of age with diabetes (type 1 and type 2) who received a foot exam (visual inspection and sensory exam with mono filament and a pulse exam) during the measurement year

cqmResults.title: Cervical Cancer Screening
cqmResults.description: Percentage of women 21-64 years of age who were screened for cervical cancer using either of the following criteria: Women age 21-64 who had cervical cytology performed every 3 years  Women age 30-64 who had cervical cytology/human papillomavirus (HPV) cotesting performed every 5 years.

cqmResults.title: Breast Cancer Screening
cqmResults.description: Percentage of women 50-74 years of age who had a mammogram to screen for breast cancer.

cqmResults.title: Use of Appropriate Medications for Asthma
cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients 5- 64 years of age who were identified as having persistent asthma and were appropriately prescribed medication during the measurement period.

cqmResults.title: Pneumococcal Vaccination Status for Older Adults
cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients 65 years of age and older who have ever received a pneumococcal vaccine

cqmResults.title: Anti-depressant Medication Management
cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients 18 years of age and older who were treated with antidepressant medication, had a diagnosis of major depression, and who remained on an antidepressant medication treatment. Two rates are reported: a. Percentage of patients who remained on an antidepressant medication for at least 84 days (12 weeks).; b. Percentage of patients who remained on an antidepressant medication for at least 180 days (6 months).

cqmResults.title: Prostate Cancer: Avoidance of Overuse of Bone Scan for Staging Low Risk Prostate Cancer Patients
cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients, regardless of age, with a diagnosis of prostate cancer at low (or very low) risk of recurrence receiving interstitial prostate brachytherapy, OR external beam radiotherapy to the prostate, OR radical prostatectomy, OR cryotherapy who did not have a bone scan performed at any time since diagnosis of prostate cancer

cqmResults.title: Colorectal Cancer Screening
cqmResults.description: Percentage of adults 50-75 years of age who had appropriate screening for colorectal cancer

cqmResults.title: Diabetes: Eye Exam
cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients 18-75 years of age with diabetes who had a retinal or dilated eye exam by an eye care professional during the measurement period or a negative retinal exam (no evidence of retinopathy) in the 12 months prior to the measurement period

cqmResults.title: Cataracts: Complications within 30 Days Following Cataract Surgery Requiring Additional Surgical Procedures
cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients aged 18 years and older with a diagnosis of uncomplicated cataract who had cataract surgery and had any of a specified list of surgical procedures in the 30 days following cataract surgery which would indicate the occurrence of any of the following major complications: retained nuclear fragments, endophthalmitis, dislocated or wrong power IOL, retinal detachment, or wound dehiscence

cqmResults.title: Cataracts: 20/40 or Better Visual Acuity within 90 Days Following Cataract Surgery
cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients aged 18 years and older with a diagnosis of uncomplicated cataract who had cataract surgery and no significant ocular conditions impacting the visual outcome of surgery and had best-corrected visual acuity of 20/40 or better (distance or near) achieved within 90 days following the cataract surgery

cqmResults.title: Diabetes: Medical Attention for Nephropathy
cqmResults.description: The percentage of patients 18-75 years of age with diabetes who had a nephropathy screening test or evidence of nephropathy during the measurement period

cqmResults.title: Heart Failure (HF): Angiotensin-Converting Enzyme (ACE) Inhibitor or Angiotensin Receptor Blocker (ARB) Therapy for Left Ventricular Systolic Dysfunction (LVSD)
cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients aged 18 years and older with a diagnosis of heart failure (HF) with a current or prior left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) < 40% who were prescribed ACE inhibitor or ARB therapy either within a 12 month period when seen in the outpatient setting OR at each hospital discharge

cqmResults.title: Follow-Up Care for Children Prescribed ADHD Medication (ADD)
cqmResults.description: Percentage of children 6-12 years of age and newly dispensed a medication for attention-deficit/hyperactivity disorder (ADHD) who had appropriate follow-up care. Two rates are reported: a. Percentage of children who had one follow-up visit with a practitioner with prescribing authority during the 30-Day Initiation Phase.; b. Percentage of children who remained on ADHD medication for at least 210 days and who, in addition to the visit in the Initiation Phase, had at least two additional follow-up visits with a practitioner within 270 days (9 months) after the Initiation Phase ended.

cqmResults.title: Initiation and Engagement of Alcohol and Other Drug Dependence Treatment
cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients 13 years of age and older with a new episode of alcohol and other drug (AOD) dependence who received the following. Two rates are reported.  Percentage of patients who initiated treatment within 14 days of the diagnosis.  Percentage of patients who initiated treatment and who had two or more additional services with an AOD diagnosis within 30 days of the initiation visit.

cqmResults.title: Breast Cancer: Hormonal Therapy for Stage I (T1b)-IIIC Estrogen Receptor/ Progesterone Receptor (ER/PR) Positive Breast Cancer
cqmResults.description: Percentage of female patients aged 18 years and older with Stage I (T1b) through IIIC, ER or PR positive breast cancer who were prescribed tamoxifen or aromatase inhibitor (AI) during the 12-month reporting period

cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients aged 18 years and older with a diagnosis of primary open-angle glaucoma (POAG) who have an optic nerve head evaluation during one or more office visits within 12 months

cqmResults.title: Heart Failure (HF): Beta-Blocker Therapy for Left Ventricular Systolic Dysfunction (LVSD)
cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients aged 18 years and older with a diagnosis of heart failure (HF) with a current or prior left ventricular ejection fraction (LVEF) < 40% who were prescribed beta-blocker therapy either within a 12 month period when seen in the outpatient setting OR at each hospital discharge

cqmResults.title: Coronary Artery Disease (CAD): Beta-Blocker Therapy-Prior Myocardial Infarction (MI) or Left Ventricular Systolic Dysfunction (LVEF <40%)

cqmResults.title: Preventive Care and Screening: Influenza Immunization

cqmResults.description: Surgical patients with prophylactic antibiotics initiated within one hour prior to surgical incision. Patients who received vancomycin or a fluoroquinolone for prophylactic antibiotics should have the antibiotics initiated within two hours prior to surgical incision. Due to the longer infusion time required for vancomycin or a fluoroquinolone, it is acceptable to start these antibiotics within two hours prior to incision time.

cqmResults.title: Initial Antibiotic Selection for Community-Acquired Pneumonia (CAP) in Immunocompetent Patients
cqmResults.description: (PN-6) Immunocompetent patients with Community-Acquired Pneumonia who receive an initial antibiotic regimen during the first 24 hours that is consistent with current guidelines. (Population 1) Immunocompetent ICU patients with Community-Acquired Pneumonia who receive an initial antibiotic regimen during the first 24 hours that is consistent with current guidelines. cqmResults.title: Appropriate Use of DXA Scans in Women Under 65 Years Who Do Not Meet the Risk Factor Profile for Osteoporotic Fracture
cqmResults.description: Percentage of female patients 50 to 64 years of age without select risk factors for osteoporotic fracture who received an order for a dual-energy x-ray absorptiometry (DXA) scan during the measurement period.

cqmResults.title: Hearing Screening Prior To Hospital Discharge

cqmResults.title: HIV Viral Suppression
cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients, regardless of age, diagnosed with HIV prior to or during the first 90 days of the measurement period, with an eligible encounter in the first 240 days of the measurement period, whose last HIV viral load test result was less than 200 copies/mL during the measurement period

cqmResults.title: Median Time from ED Arrival to ED Departure for Discharged ED Patients
cqmResults.description: Median elapsed time from emergency department arrival to emergency room departure for patients discharged from the emergency department

cqmResults.title: Cesarean Birth
cqmResults.description: Nulliparous women with a term, singleton baby in a vertex position delivered by cesarean birth

cqmResults.title: Statin Therapy for the Prevention and Treatment of Cardiovascular Disease
cqmResults.description: Percentage of the following patients - all considered at high risk of cardiovascular events - who were prescribed or were on statin therapy during the measurement period: Adults aged >= 21 years who were previously diagnosed with or currently have an active diagnosis of clinical atherosclerotic cardiovascular disease (ASCVD); OR Adults aged >= 21 years who have ever had a fasting or direct low-density lipoprotein cholesterol (LDL-C) level >= 190 mg/dL or were previously diagnosed with or currently have an active diagnosis of familial or pure hypercholesterolemia; OR Adults aged 40-75 years with a diagnosis of diabetes with a fasting or direct LDL-C level of 70-189 mg/dL

cqmResults.title: HIV Screening
cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients 15-65 years of age who have been tested for HIV within that age range

cqmResults.title: Closing the Referral Loop: Receipt of Specialist Report
cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients with referrals, regardless of age, for which the referring provider receives a report from the provider to whom the patient was referred

cqmResults.title: Safe Use of Opioids- Concurrent Prescribing
cqmResults.description: Proportion of inpatient hospitalizations for patients 18 years of age and older prescribed, or continued on, two or more opioids or an opioid and benxodiazepine concurrently at discharge

cqmResults.title: HIV/AIDS: Pneumocystis Jiroveci Pneumonia (PCP) Prophylaxis
cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients aged 6 weeks and older with a diagnosis of HIV/AIDS who were prescribed Pneumocystis jiroveci pneumonia (PCP) prophylaxis

cqmResults.title: Core Clinical Data Elements for the Hybrid Hospital-Wide Readmission (HWR) Measure with Claims and Electronic Health Record Data
cqmResults.description: This logic is intended to extract electronic clinical data. This is not an electronic clinical quality measure and this logic will not produce measure results. Instead, it will produce a file containing the data that CMS will link with administrative claims to risk adjust the Hybrid HWR outcome measure. It is designed to extract the first resulted set of vital signs and basic laboratory results obtained from encounters for adult Medicare Fee-For-Service patients admitted to acute care short stay hospitals.

cqmResults.title: Primary PCI Received Within 90 Minutes of Hospital Arrival
cqmResults.description: Acute myocardial infarction (AMI) patients with ST-segment elevation on the ECG closest to arrival time receiving primary PCI during the hospital stay with a time from hospital arrival to PCI of 90 minutes or less

cqmResults.title: Median Time from ED Arrival to ED Departure for Admitted ED Patients
cqmResults.description: Median time from emergency department arrival to time of departure from the emergency room for patients admitted to the facility from the emergency department

cqmResults.title: Functional Status Assessment for Total Hip Replacement
cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients 18 years of age and older who received an elective primary total hip arthroplasty (THA) and completed a functional status assessment within 90 days prior to the surgery and in the 270-365 days after the surgery

cqmResults.title: Fibrinolytic Therapy Received Within 30 Minutes of Hospital Arrival
cqmResults.description: Acute myocardial infarction (AMI) patients with ST-segment elevation on the ECG closest to arrival time receiving fibrinolytic therapy during the hospital stay and having a time from hospital arrival to fibrinolysis of 30 minutes or less.

cqmResults.title: Preventive Care and Screening: Cholesterol - Fasting Low Density Lipoprotein (LDL-C) Test Performed
cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients aged 20 through 79 years whose risk factors have been assessed and a fasting LDL-C test has been performed.

cqmResults.title: HIV/AIDS: Medical Visit

cqmResults.title: Preventive Care and Screening: Risk-Stratified Cholesterol -Fasting Low Density Lipoprotein (LDL-C)

cqmResults.title: Bone density evaluation for patients with prostate cancer and receiving androgen deprivation therapy
cqmResults.description: Patients determined as having prostate cancer who are currently starting or undergoing androgen deprivation therapy (ADT), for an anticipated period of 12 months or greater and who receive an initial bone density evaluation. The bone density evaluation must be prior to the start of ADT or within 3 months of the start of ADT.

cqmResults.title: Intravesical Bacillus-Calmette-Guerin for non-muscle invasive bladder cancer
cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients initially diagnosed with non-muscle invasive bladder cancer and who received intravesical Bacillus-Calmette-Guerin (BCG) within 6 months of bladder cancer staging.

cqmResults.title: Hypertension: Improvement in Blood Pressure

cqmResults.title: Functional Status Assessment for Total Knee Replacement

This list must include ALL known prescriptions, over-the-counters, herbals, and vitamin/mineral/dietary (nutritional) supplements AND  must contain the medications' name, dosage, frequency and route of administration.

cqmResults.title: Venous Thromboembolism Patients with Anticoagulation Overlap Therapy
cqmResults.description: This measure assesses the number of patients diagnosed with confirmed VTE who received an overlap of parenteral (intravenous [IV] or subcutaneous [subcu]) anticoagulation and warfarin therapy. For patients who received less than five days of overlap therapy, they should be discharged on both medications or have a reason for discontinuation of overlap therapy. Overlap therapy should be administered for at least five days with an international normalized ratio (INR) greater than or equal to 2 prior to discontinuation of the parenteral anticoagulation therapy, discharged on both medications or have a reason for discontinuation of overlap therapy

cqmResults.title: Primary Caries Prevention Intervention as Offered by Primary Care Providers, including Dentists
cqmResults.description: Percentage of children, age 0-20 years, who received a fluoride varnish application during the measurement period

cqmResults.title: Children Who Have Dental Decay or Cavities

cqmResults.title: HIV/AIDS: RNA control for Patients with HIV
cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients aged 13 years and older with a diagnosis of HIV/AIDS, with at least two visits during the measurement year, with at least 90 days between each visit, whose most recent HIV RNA level is <200 copies/mL.

cqmResults.title: International Prostate Symptom Score (IPSS) or American Urological Association-Symptom Index (AUA-SI) Change 6-12 Months After Diagnosis of Benign Prostatic Hyperplasia

cqmResults.description: This measure assesses the number of inpatient hospitalizations for patients age 18 and older who have been administered an opioid medication and are subsequently administered an opioid antagonist within 12 hours, an indication of an opioid-related adverse event

cqmResults.title: Maternal Depression Screening
cqmResults.description: The percentage of children who turned 6 months of age during the measurement year, who had a face-to-face visit between the clinician and the child during child's first 6 months, and who had a maternal depression screening for the mother at least once between 0 and 6 months of life

cqmResults.title: Hospital Harm - Pressure Injury
cqmResults.description: The measure assesses the number of inpatient hospitalizations for patients aged 18 and older who suffer the harm of developing a new stage 2, stage 3, stage 4, deep tissue, or unstageable pressure injury

cqmResults.title: Hospital Harm - Acute Kidney Injury
cqmResults.description: The measure assesses the number of inpatient hospitalizations for patients age 18 and older who have an acute kidney injury (stage 2 or greater) that occurred during the encounter. Acute kidney injury (AKI) stage 2 or greater is defined as a substantial increase in serum creatinine value, or by the initiation of kidney dialysis (continuous renal replacement therapy (CRRT), hemodialysis or peritoneal dialysis).

cqmResults.title: Core Clinical Data Elements for the Hybrid Hospital-Wide (All-Condition, All-Procedure) Risk-Standardized Mortality Measure (HWM)
cqmResults.description: This logic is intended to extract electronic clinical data. This is not an electronic clinical quality measure and this logic will not produce measure results. Instead, it will produce a file containing the data that CMS will link with administrative claims to risk adjust the Hybrid HWM outcome measure. It is designed to extract the first resulted set of vital signs and basic laboratory results obtained from encounters for adult Medicare Fee-For-Service patients admitted to acute care short stay hospitals.

cqmResults.title: Hospital Harm - Severe Hyperglycemia
cqmResults.description: This measure assesses the number of inpatient hospital days with a hyperglycemic event (harm) per the total qualifying inpatient hospital days for that encounter for patients 18 years of age or older at admission

cqmResults.title: Exclusive Breast Milk Feeding
cqmResults.description: Exclusive breast milk feeding during the newborn's entire hospitalization

cqmResults.title: Functional Status Assessments for Congestive Heart Failure
cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients 18 years of age and older with congestive heart failure who completed initial and follow-up patient-reported functional status assessments

cqmResults.title: Thrombolytic Therapy
cqmResults.description: Acute ischemic stroke patients who arrive at this hospital within 2 hours of time last known well and for whom t-PA was initiated at this hospital within 3 hours of time last known well.

cqmResults.title: Kidney Health Evaluation
cqmResults.description: Percentage of patients aged 18-75 years with a diagnosis of diabetes who received a kidney health evaluation defined by an Estimated Glomerular Filtration Rate (eGFR) AND Urine Albumin-Creatinine Ratio (uACR) within the measurement period

cqmResults.title: Global Malnutrition Composite Score
cqmResults.description: This measure assesses the percentage of hospitalizations for adults aged 65 years and older at the start of the inpatient encounter during the measurement period with a length of stay equal to or greater than 24 hours who received optimal malnutrition care during the current inpatient hospitalization where care performed was appropriate to the patient's level of malnutrition risk and severity. Malnutrition care best practices recommend that for each hospitalization, adult inpatients are screened for malnutrition risk, assessed to confirm findings of malnutrition risk or for a hospital dietitian referral order, and if identified with a "moderate" or "severe" malnutrition status in the current performed malnutrition assessment, receive a current "moderate" or "severe" malnutrition diagnosis and have a current nutrition care plan performed.

cqmResults.title: Appropriate Treatment for ST-Segment Elevation Myocardial Infarction (STEMI) Patients in the Emergency Department (ED)
cqmResults.description: Percentage of emergency department (ED) encounters for patients 18 years and older with a diagnosis of ST-segment elevation myocardial infarction (STEMI) that received appropriate treatment, defined as fibrinolytic therapy within 30 minutes of ED arrival, percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI) within 90 minutes of ED arrival, or transfer within 45 minutes of ED arrival

ucdProcesses.name: NISTIR 7741
ucdProcesses.details: UCD serves to engineer improved usability and human performance into a system or device, via an iterative process, inclusive of the following principles: Understand user needs, workflows and work environments, guidance on usability, engage users early and often, set user performance objectives, design the user interface from known human behavior principles and familiar user interface models, conduct usability tests to measure how well the interface meets user needs, and adapt the design and iteratively test with users until performance objectives are met. For each iteration, critical points and issues are uncovered which can be improved upon and implemented in subsequent releases.
